data.title: Medicinema • A podcast on Spotify for Podcasters
data.meta_description:
- A healthy dose of Film
Devyn & Georg discuss 2 movies each episode in spoiler discussions, in an effort to dig deeper into the artform that we all love so much.
data.text:
During this appointment Devyn and Georg discuss two films from the omen franchise.

First the original "The Omen" from the year 1976 and than the new prequel "the first Omen" from 2024.

Timestamps: 0:00:00 Intro + Sony buys Alamo Drafthouse 0:08:44 the Omen (1976) directed by Richard Donner

0:42:34 the first Omen (2024) directed by Arkasha Stevenson

Corrections: - Devyn said that alamo has a ban for life policy with phones which i couldnt find online but they have a strict no phone policy and will kick you out.

-Devyn said that the sister was part of the lore in sequels, according to a collider article however layla was a new addition of "the first omen" changing the canon

Prescription for Appointment #017:

Videodrome (1983) directed by David Cronenberg

I saw the TV glow (2024) directed by Jane Schoenbrun

Medicinema Linktree: https://linktr.ee/Medicinema Logo and Character Designs: Denise Hasenzagl https://instagram.com/hazlnuss?igshid=OGQ5ZDc2ODk2ZA==

During this appointment Devyn and Georg discuss two A24 films featuring buff people struggling.

Timestamps: 0:00:00 Intro + Roger Corman in Memoriam

0:04:28 The Iron Claw (2023) directed by Sean Durkin

0:43:52 Love Lies Bleeding (2024) directed by Rose Glass

Corrections:

Devyn said Japan Started Womens Wrestling: Apparently there existed a handfull of women's Wrestling Championships in america from 1910 to 1953. The Sport seemed to really pick up toward the end of the 60s and Japan played a major part than.

Devyn also complaint about the movie being "inspired by" and not "based on", the opening titlecard however does call it "inspired by" just like he wished for

Prescription for Appointment #015:

the Omen (1976) directed by Richard Donner

the first Omen (2024) directed by Arkasha Stevenson

Medicinema Linktree: https://linktr.ee/Medicinema Logo and Character Designs: Denise Hasenzagl https://instagram.com/hazlnuss?igshid=OGQ5ZDc2ODk2ZA==

During this appointment Devyn and Georg discuss two movies using and showcasing stopmotion animation. First the directorial debut by Robert Morgan Stopmotion (2023). It follows the life of a struggling stop-motion animator fighting with her inner demons. Than the 2018 released avant garde stop-motion film the wolf house. The international co-production is told like a fairy tale with a dark subtext.

Timestamps:

0:00:00 Intro

0:01:07 Stopmotion (2023)

0:42:05 the Wolf House (2018)

Corrections:

-Devyn said Jim Henson passed after the Dark Crystal. The Dark Crystal released in 1982, Labyrinth released in 1986 and Jim Henson kept on working for 4 years after that. He died in 1990. The financial flop of those 2definetly played a role in him not working on another dark puppet feature in those last remaining years.

Prescription for Appointment #012:

-District 9 (2009) directed by Neill Blomkamp

-Close Encounters of the Third Kind (1977) directed by Steven Spielberg

During this appointment Devyn and Georg discuss two very different unorthodox world war 2 movies.

First the 2019 Taika Waititi satire Jojo Rabbit starring Scarlett Johanssonn and Thomasin McKenzie.

Than the new Jonathan Glazer film the Zone of Interest that just won the International Feature award at the Oscars Christian Friedel and Sandra Hüller.

Timestamps:

0:00:00 Intro + Top 10 best payed Actors in 2023

0:06:08 Jojo Rabbit (2019)

0:47:32 The Zone of Interest (2023)

Corrections:

-

Prescription for Appointment #010:

- Rent a Cat (2012) directed by Naoko Ogigami

- Perfect Days (2023) directed by Wim Wenders

During this appointment Devyn and Georg discuss 2 very stylised frankenstein inspired movies.

First the early Tim Burton movie Edward Scissorhands. It was released in 1990 for 20th Century Fox and Jonny Depp with Winona Ryder alongside the legend Vincent Price.

Afterwards the new Yorgos Lantimos film Poor Things. Premiering in 2023 at the Venice Filmfestival for Searchlight Pictures, it stars Emma Stone, William Dafoe and Mark Ruffalo.

Timestamps:

0:00:00 Intro + discussing Coyote vs Akme being shelfed

0:12:31 Edward Scissorhands (1990)

0:55:22 Poor Things (2023)

Corrections:

Devyn said Winona Ryder went on to make "Beetlejuice" with Burton but "Beettlejuice" released 2 years before "Edward Scissorhands" in 1988 .

Prescription for Appointment #008:

- All of us Strangers (2023)

- the Discarnates (1988)
